result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final statement of hours
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF191 and #22CF433 called at 8:40am 
Defendant Mari L Caster in court with Attorney Karl Huebner (#22CF191) and Attorney Cassi Nelson (#22CF433).  ADA Theresa Beck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner asks to withdraw as counsel, now that it has been determined that Ms. Caster qualifies for Public Defender representation. 
The Court discharges Attorney Huebner as counsel [in case #22CF191].
Attorney Nelson indicates that the PD will now appoint her as counsel in the case. 
In response to the Court's inquiry of Ms. Caster regarding her address, Ms. Caster indicates that she is homeless. She provides her current mailing address as: 
c/o Workforce Development Center, 874 Collins Road in Jefferson. 
recess 8:47am 

NEXT:  (1) in case #22CF433 Attorney Huebner has been discharged as court-appointed counsel; if a PD order is not filed today, then the Jefferson PD Office should be added to the mailing matrix in #22CF433, 
 (2) Status Conference on November 10th at 9:30am  [JA-note in comments that case #22CF433 is at prelim stage]

Defendant Mari L Caster in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Michael C. Witt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt:
Amended Bond.  Conditions of this Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--not to discipline any child; no discipline whatsoever of any child.

[MK] case called at 2:21pm 
Defendant Mari L Caster in court. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and the State's officer-witness is present. 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.
Right to counsel is reviewed.  The Court directs Ms. Caster to go now to the Clerk of Courts Office to complete and file a petition for the appointment of counsel.  
The Court finds good cause to extend the preliminary hearing time limits.  
The Court amends the Bond to add the condition: not to discipline any child; no discipline whatsoever of any child. 
recess 2:25pm.
